gurmukhi: iqn ieh kl mo Drmu clwXo ] sB swDn ko rwh bqwXo ]
transliteration: Tin Eh Kal Mo Dharam(u) Chalaayo|| Sabh Saadhan Ko Raah(u) Bataayo||
translation: Guru Nanak spread Dharma in the Iron age and put the seekers on the path.

gurmukhi: jo qwN ky mwrg mih Awey ] qy kbhUM nhI pwp sMqwey ]5]
transliteration: Jo Taan Ke Maarag Maih Aae|| Te Kab-hoon Nahoo Paap Santaae||5||
translation: Those who followed the path propagated by him, were never harmed by the vices.5.

gurmukhi: jy jy pMQ qvn ky pry ] pwp qwp iqn ky pRB hry ]
transliteration: Je Je Panth Tavan Ke Dare|| Paap Taap Tin Ke Prabh Dare||
translation: All those who came within his fold, they were absolved of all their sins and troubles,

gurmukhi: dUK BUK kbhUM n sMqwey ] jwl kwl ky bIc n Awey ]6]
transliteration: Dookh Bhookh Kab-hoon Na Santaae|| Jaal Kaal Ke Boodhe Na Aae||6||
translation: Their sorrows, their wants were vanished and even their transmigration came to and end.6.

gurmukhi: nwnk AMgd ko bpu Drw ] Drm pRcur ieh jg mo krw ]
transliteration: Naanak Anad Ko Bap(u) Dharaa|| Dharam Prachar Eh Jag Mo Karaa||
translation: Nanak transformed himself to Angad and spread Dharma in the world.

gurmukhi: Amrdws puin nwmu khwXo ] jn dIpk qy dIp jgwXo ]7]
transliteration: Amardaas Poun(i) Naam(u) Kahaayo|| Jan Doopak Te Doop Jagadyo||7||
translation: He was called Amar Das in the next transformation, a lamp was lit from the lamp.7.

gurmukhi: jb brdwn smY vhu Awvw ] rwmdws qb gurU khwvw ]
transliteration: Jah Bardaan Samai Vahu Aavaa|| Raamdaas Tab Guroo Kahaavaa||
translation: When the opportune time came for the boon, then the Guru was called Ram Das.

gurmukhi: iqh brdwn purwqn dIAw ] Amrdws surpuir mgu lIAw ]8]
transliteration: Tih Bardaan Puraatan Dooaa|| Amardaas Surpur(i) Mag(u) Looaa||8||
translation: The old boon was bestowed upon him, when Amar Das departed for the heavens.8.

gurmukhi: sRI nwnk AMgid kir mwnw ] Amrdws AMgd pihcwnw ]
transliteration: Sroo Naanak Anad(i) Kar(i) Maanaa|| Amardaas Anad Pahichaanaa||
translation: Sri Nanak was recognized in Angad, and Angad in Amar Das.

gurmukhi: Amrdws rwmdws khwXo ] swDin lKw mUVH nih pwXo ]9]
transliteration: Amardaas Raamdaas Kahaayo|| Saadhan(i) Lakhaa Moondh Nah(i) Paayo||9||
translation: Amar Das was called Ram Das, only the saints know it and the fools did not.9.

gurmukhi: iBMn iBMn sBhUM kr jwnw ] eyk rUp iknhUM pihcwnw ]
transliteration: Bhinn Bhinn Sabh-hoon Kar Jaanaa|| Ek Roop Kin-hoon Pahichaanaa||
translation: The people on the whole considered them as separate ones, but there were few who recognized them as one and the same.

gurmukhi: ijn jwnw iqn hI isD pweI ] ibn smJy isD hwiQ n AweI ]10]
transliteration: Jin Jaanaa Tin Hoo Sidh Paaoo|| Bin Samjhe Sidh Haath(i) Na Aaoo||10||
translation: Those who recognized them as One, they were successful on the spiritual plane. Without recognition there was no success.10.

gurmukhi: rwmdws hir so iml gey ] gurqw dyq Arjnih Bey ]
transliteration: Raamdaas Har(i) So Mil Gad|| Gurtaa Det Arjanah(i) Bhae||
translation: When Ramdas merged in the Lord, the Guruship was bestowed upon Arjan.
